meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or distance.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah can outfoot any other animal in a race.
meanings.sent2: The hare tried to outfoot the tortoise in the race.
meanings.sent3: The rocket ship decided to outfoot the airplane in a friendly competition.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outfoot her previous record was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The champion sprinter always manages to outfoot her opponents with ease.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outperform in a competition or activity.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outfoot her classmates in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outfoot their rivals in the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to outfoot his own trick from the previous show.
meanings.sent4: His creativity always allows him to outfoot others in the art competition.
meanings.sent5: The young inventor was determined to outfoot all expectations with her latest creation.
